headline.main: Association for Relief of Aged Indigent Females.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Thirty-ninth Annual Meeting of this Society was held at the Asylum in Twentieth-street, yesterday; 12 o'clock was the appointed hour, but the weather being unpleasant the opening of business was postponed to one; even then the attendance was thin. This Asylum was founded in the year 1838. The demands on the Society have of late so increased, that they find accommodation for 200 persons would be required.

docs.lead_paragraph: A DISGRACEFUL SCENE AT THE LOWER POLICE COURT.--Yesterday forenoon, between the hours of 10 and 11 o'clock, a most disgraceful scene was enacted at the Lower Police Court, Halls of Justice, in presence of the sitting Magistrate.

headline.main: The Tendency and Effect of National Prosperity.; Thanksgiving Sermon--By Rev. Henry W. Bellows, D. D.
Home and Its Blessings.; A Thanksgiving Discourse, by Wm. Adams, D.D. Delivered in the Presbyterian Church, Broome-st
THANKSGIVING SERMONS.; Our Country and its Destiny. Sermon by Rev. Samuel D. Cochran, at the Broadway Tabernacle.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Thanksgiving discourse at the Broadway Tabernacle was preached yesterday morning by Rev. SAMUEL D. COCHRAN, of Paterson, N. J. Although this gentleman is not so widely known in our community as others whose sermons we notice this morning, we feel satisfied that the interesting sketch we give of his appropriate and practical effort upon this occasion, will lead our readers to desire to hear and know more of him.

docs.lead_paragraph: METROPOLITAN ACADEMY.--A new enterprise in education has been commenced in this City, under the title of the Metropolitan Academy. The object is to combine the Academic and Collegiate departments of study in a regular course. The Academy is a handsome Freestone structure, five stories in height, covering two lots at Nos. 93 and 95 Sixth-Avenue.

headline.main: HOUSE OF REFUGE AT RANDALL'S ISLAND.; LAYING OF THE CORNER-STONE. Addresses by Mayor Kingsland and Robert Kelly, Esq.

docs.lead_paragraph: The "Society for Reformation of Juvenile Delinquents" laid the corner-stone of their new "House of Refuge," on Randall's Island, yesterday. The steamboat Ravenswood left Peck-slip at 11 A.M. The morning was fine, and several gentlemen attended on the invitation of the Committee. Besides the officers of the Society.

headline.main: PHILADELPHIA.; City Architecture--Habitatious for the Million--Two new American Orders of Architecture--Reflections upon High Life and the Follies of the Times, and a Recipe given to make City Lite berfectly Agreeable and Happy to Everybody.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was observed by TRANQUILLUS SEUTONIUS that the Emperor AUGUSTUS found Rome built of wood, and left it adorned with marble. It is not to imperial power, except in few lands, that we look now for the most splendid and imposing illus trations of metropolitan taste and opulence as displayed in architecture.
